column4: does anyone know how to set the document root in apache2? i tried editing apache2.conf and setting DocumentRoot but it doesn't do anything
did you restart apache?
yep. im used to running it on windows so i'm familiar with it
(or apache2, even ;)
how about editing what's in sites-enabled?
you just lost me
/etc/apache2/sites-enabled/000-default
hooray, that worked. thanks
good.
now, can you fix *my* apache problem :)
not likely i installed linux for the first time three days ago :O
hehe :)
i would just install it in /usr/lib/java, then setup symlinks in /usr/local/bin to anything you want
what do you mean by 'install it'? just move the entire folder there?
yup
mkdir /usr/lib/java && mv jre-whatever /usr/lib/java

well it's the JDK not the jre. it has a bunch of different folders inside the main folder (bin, demo, include, lib, man, jre).  for example i can't type 'man javac' and i can't use javac from any location. it's like it isn't installed properly
very true. you will have to do some stuff to get it "installed properly"
follow ubotu's instructions
it should work for the jdk too

i tried the wiki guide, it says to convert the .bin into a .deb but i tried that and it fails horribly. it says in the wiki "you may get this error, do this to fix it". i get the error and doing what it says to fix it didn't fix it. :P
